sclose information about you as a developer when you access or use developer.marketplace.cake.com, dev-docs.marketplace.cake.com,dev-forum.marketplace.cake.com  (collectively with any successor websites thereto, our “<em><strong class="font-semibold">Sites</strong></em>”).</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">We may change this Privacy Policy from time to time. If we make changes, we will notify you by revising the date at the top of this policy and, in some cases, we may provide you with additional notice (such as adding a statement to our website or sending you a notification). We encourage you to review this Privacy Policy regularly to stay informed about our information practices and the choices available to you.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Terms not defined in this Privacy Policy have the same meaning as the CAKE.com Developer Terms, available at <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://dev-docs.marketplace.cake.com/terms/" class="link_03735  link_3b154 inline-link_3b154">https://dev-docs.marketplace.cake.com/terms/</a>. If you are a consumer or a Business User browsing our public websites to learn about our products and services, see our website Privacy Policy available at Clockify, Pumble and Plaky.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">CONTENTS</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Collection of Information
Use of Information
Sharing of Information
Advertising and Analytics
Your Choices
Additional Disclosures for Individuals in Europe
Contact Us</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">COLLECTION OF INFORMATION</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">The information we collect from you varies depending on how you interact with us. If you use our Sites as an individual developer or entity with a Developer Account, we describe below the categories of information we collect from you and the sources of this information.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Information You Provide to Us</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">We collect information you provide directly to us. For example, you share information directly with us when you create an account, submit Add-Ons, use our Sites, submit or post content through our Sites, fill out a form, communicate with us via third-party platforms, request developer support, or otherwise communicate with us.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">The types of personal information that we collect could generally include:</p>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Account information</strong></em>: your name, account username and password, email, language, time zone, phone number, photograph, personal API key, any communications you provide, and any other information you choose to provide.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Professional information</strong></em>: work contact details, title, employer, job title.</li>
</ul>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Not providing certain personal information may prevent CAKE.com from providing the Sites to you (e.g., without your email, we may not be able to create an account for you).</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Information We Collect Automatically When You Interact with Us</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">When you access or use our Sites or otherwise transact business with us, we automatically collect certain information, including:</p>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Device and usage information</strong></em>: We collect information about how you access our Sites, including data about the device and network you use, such as your hardware model, operating system version, mobile network, IP address, unique device identifiers, browser type, device time zone, and app version. We also collect information about your activity on our Sites, such as access times, pages viewed, links clicked, and the page you visited before navigating to our Sites.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Information collected by cookies and similar tracking technologies</strong></em>: We (and our service providers) use tracking technologies, such as cookies and web beacons, to collect information about you. Cookies are small data files stored on your hard drive or in device memory that help us improve our Sites and your experience, see which areas and features of our Sites are popular, and count visits. Web beacons (also known as “pixel tags” or “clear GIFs”) are electronic images that we use on our Sites and in our emails to help deliver cookies, count visits, and understand usage and campaign effectiveness.</li>
</ul>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Information We Collect from Other Sources</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">We obtain information from third-party sources. For example, if you create or log into your CAKE.com account through a third-party platform (such as Google), we will have access to certain information from that platform in accordance with the authorization procedures determined by such platform.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Information We Derive</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">We may derive information or draw inferences about you based on the information we collect.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">USE OF INFORMATION</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">We use the information we collect to provide, maintain, and improve our products and services. We also use the information we collect to:</p>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Provide you the Sites and facilitate our business relationship with you;</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Process and facilitate transactions and send you related information, including confirmations; receipts, invoices, and customer experience surveys;</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Send you technical notices, security alerts, and support and administrative messages;</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Respond to your comments and questions and provide developer services;</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Communicate with you about products, services, and events offered by CAKE.com and others and provide news and information that we think will interest you (see the Your Choices section below for information about how to opt out of these communications at any time);</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Personalize and improve your experience on our Sites;</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Monitor and analyze trends, usage, and activities in connection with our Sites;</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Detect, investigate, and prevent security incidents and other malicious, deceptive, fraudulent, or illegal activity and protect the rights and property of CAKE.com and others;</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Debug to identify and repair errors in our Sites;</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Comply with our legal and financial obligations; and</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Carry out any other purpose described to you at the time the information was collected.</li>
</ul>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">SHARING OF INFORMATION</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">We share personal information in the following circumstances or as otherwise described in this policy:</p>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">We share personal information at your direction with other third parties with whom you have directed us to share certain information.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">We share personal information with vendors, service providers, and consultants that need access to personal information in order to perform services for us, such as companies that assist us with web hosting, payment processing, CMR tools, fraud prevention, customer service, and marketing and advertising.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">We may disclose personal information if we believe that disclosure is in accordance with, or required by, any applicable law or legal process, including lawful requests by public authorities to meet national security or law enforcement requirements.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">We may share personal information if we believe that your actions are inconsistent with our user agreements or policies, if we believe that you have violated the law, or if we believe it is necessary to protect the rights, property, and safety of CAKE.com, our users, the public, or others.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">We share personal information with our lawyers and other professional advisors where necessary to obtain advice or otherwise protect and manage our business interests.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">We may share personal information in connection with, or during negotiations concerning, any merger, sale of company assets, financing, or acquisition of all or a portion of our business by another company.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Personal information is shared between and among CAKE.com and our current and future parents, affiliates, and subsidiaries and other companies under common control and ownership.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">We share personal information with your consent or at your direction.</li>
</ul>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">ADVERTISING AND ANALYTICS</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">We allow others to provide analytics services on our web and in mobile apps. These entities may use cookies, web beacons, device identifiers, and other technologies to collect information about your use of our Sites and applications, including your IP address, web browser, mobile network information, pages viewed, time spent on pages or in mobile apps, links clicked, and conversion information. This information may be used by CAKE.com and others to, among other things, analyze and track data, determine the popularity of certain content, deliver advertising and content targeted to your interests on our Sites, and better understand your online activity.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">YOUR CHOICES</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Account Information</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">You may update and correct certain account information at any time by logging into your account or emailing us at <a href="mailto:support@cake.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" class="link_03735  link_3b154 inline-link_3b154">support@cake.com</a>. If you wish to delete your account (via a user settings page, by email or otherwise), please note that we may retain certain information as required by law or for our legitimate business purposes.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Cookies</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Most web browsers are set to accept cookies by default. If you prefer, you can usually adjust your browser settings to remove or reject browser cookies. Please note that removing or rejecting cookies could affect the availability and functionality of our Sites.  CAKE.com only uses strictly necessary cookies.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">ADDITIONAL DISCLOSURES FOR INDIVIDUALS IN EUROPE</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">If you are located in the European Economic Area (“<em><strong class="font-semibold">EEA</strong></em>”), the United Kingdom, or Switzerland, and you are an individual with a Developer Account whose personal information we control, you have certain rights and protections under the law regarding the processing of your personal information, and this section applies to you.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Legal Basis for Processing</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">When we process personal information, to the extent required by applicable law, we will do so in reliance on the following lawful bases:</p>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">To perform our responsibilities under our contract with you (e.g., processing payments for and providing the products and services you requested).</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">When we have a legitimate interest in processing your personal information to operate our business or protect our interests (e.g., to provide, maintain, and improve our products and services, conduct data analytics, and communicate with you).</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">To comply with our legal obligations (e.g., to maintain a record of your consents and track those who have opted out of marketing communications).</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">When we have your consent to do so (e.g., when you opt in to receive marketing communications from us). When consent is the legal basis for our processing your personal information, you may withdraw such consent at any time.</li>
</ul>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Data Retention</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">We store your personal information for as long as necessary to carry out the purposes for which we originally collected it and for other legitimate business purposes, including to meet our legal, regulatory, or other compliance obligations.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Data Subject Requests</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">To the extent required under applicable law, you have the right of:</p>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Access.</strong></em> You have the right to request a copy of the personal information we are processing about you, which we will provide to you in electronic form.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Rectification.</strong></em> You have the right to require that any incomplete or inaccurate personal information that we process about you is amended.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Deletion.</strong></em> You have the right to request that we delete personal information that we process about you, unless, for example, we are required to retain such data in order to comply with a legal obligation or to establish, exercise or defend legal claims.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Restriction.</strong></em> You have the right to request that we restrict our processing of your personal information where: (i) you believe such data to be inaccurate; (ii) our processing is unlawful; or (iii) we no longer need to process such data for a particular purpose, but where we are not able to delete the data due to a legal or other obligation or because you do not want us to delete it.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Portability</strong></em>. You have the right to request that we transmit the personal information we hold with respect to you to another data controller.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Objection.</strong></em> Where the legal justification for our processing of your personal information is our legitimate interest, you have the right to object to such processing on grounds relating to your situation (e.g., direct marketing).  We will abide by your request unless we have compelling legitimate grounds for the processing which override your interests and rights, or if we need to continue to process the data for the establishment, exercise or defense of a legal claim.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Withdrawing Consent.</strong></em>  If you have consented to our processing of your personal information, you have the right to withdraw your consent at any time, free of charge. Please note that if you withdraw your consent, this will not affect the lawfulness of our use and processing of your information on the basis of your consent before the point in time when you withdraw your consent.</li>
</ul>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Some rights may be limited, and we may need to retain certain personal information, as required or permitted by applicable law. If you would like to further inquire about, or exercise any of these rights, please contact us at <a href="mailto:support@cake.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" class="link_03735  link_3b154 inline-link_3b154">support@cake.com</a>.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">International data transfer</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">We take steps to ensure that we handle your personal information subject to appropriate safeguards. As a US-based company, most of our operations are conducted in the United States and in order to provide the Sites, personal information will be processed in the United States, where laws regarding processing of personal information may be less stringent than the laws in your country. We provide appropriate protections for cross-border transfers as required by applicable law for international data transfers.  With respect to transfers originating from the European Economic Area, Switzerland or the UK, where applicable, the standard contractual clauses and the international data transfer addendum to the European Commission’s standard contractual clauses for international data transfers, approved by the European Commission and the UK Information Commissioner, respectively, are implemented. Where required by such laws, you may request a copy of the suitable mechanisms we have in place by contacting us as detailed below.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">In some cases, we may provide you with the option to choose the location, including locations in the EEA, in which we store and process your data.  To the extent we provide that option to you, we will only process and store your data in the designated location and not transfer your data outside that jurisdiction, except in accordance with applicable law.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Questions or Complaints</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">If you have a concern about our processing of personal information that we are not able to resolve, you have the right to lodge a complaint with the Data Protection Authority where you reside. Contact details for your Data Protection Authority can be found using the links below:</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">For individuals in the EEA: <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://edpb.europa.eu/about-edpb/board/members_en" class="link_03735  link_3b154 inline-link_3b154">https://edpb.europa.eu/about-edpb/board/members_en</a></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">For individuals in the UK: <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://ico.org.uk/global/contact-us/" class="link_03735  link_3b154 inline-link_3b154">https://ico.org.uk/global/contact-us/</a></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">For individuals in Switzerland: <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://www.edoeb.admin.ch/edoeb/en/home/the-fdpic/contact.html" class="link_03735  link_3b154 inline-link_3b154">https://www.edoeb.admin.ch/edoeb/en/home/the-fdpic/contact.html</a></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">CONTACT US</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at <a href="mailto:support@cake.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" class="link_03735  link_3b154 inline-link_3b154">support@cake.com</a>.</p>

Palo Alto, CA
94303, USA
</code></div></div>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">For our users in the EEA, the United Kingdom, or Switzerland, you may also contact our Data Protection Officer at <a href="mailto:support@cake.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" class="link_03735  link_3b154 inline-link_3b154">support@cake.com</a></p></div><div class="rspress-doc-footer"><footer class="mt-8"><div class="xs:flex pb-5 px-2 justify-end items-center"></div><div class="flex flex-col"></div><div class="flex flex-col sm:flex-row sm:justify-around gap-4 pt-6"><div class="prev_e7091 flex flex-col"></div><div class="next_e7091 flex flex-col"></div></div></footer></div></div></div><button class="scroll-to-top_1a167 "><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="currentColor" class="w-6 h-6"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M11.47 2.47a.75.75 0 0 1 1.06 0l7.5 7.5a.75.75 0 1 1-1.06 1.06l-6.22-6.22V21a.75.75 0 0 1-1.5 0V4.81l-6.22 6.22a.75.75 0 1 1-1.06-1.06l7.5-7.5Z" clip-rule="evenodd"></path></svg></button><div class="aside-container_edeb4"><div><div class="flex flex-col"><div class="&lt;lg:hidden"><div id="aside-container" class="relative text-sm font-medium"><div class="leading-7 block text-sm font-semibold pl-3">ON THIS PAGE</div><nav class="mt-1"><ul class="relative"><li><a href="#cakecom-developer-privacy-policy" title="CAKE.COM DEVELOPER PRIVACY POLICY" class="aside-link transition-all duration-300 hover:text-text-1 text-text-2 block aside-active" style="margin-left: 0px;"><span class="aside-link-text block">CAKE.COM DEVELOPER PRIVACY POLICY</span></a></li></ul></nav></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></section><div class="footer-wrapper"><p class="footer-item">© 2025 CAKE.com Inc. class="rspress-sidebar-item"><a class="link_03735 menuLink_71eca cursor-pointer" target="" href="/pumble/build/triggers-reference.html"><div class="menuItem_71eca mt-0.5 py-2 px-3 font-medium flex" style="font-size: 13px; margin-left: 18px; border-radius: 0 var(--rp-radius) var(--rp-radius) 0;"><span>Triggers</span></div></a></div><div class="rspress-sidebar-item"><a class="link_03735 menuLink_71eca cursor-pointer" target="" href="/pumble/build/interactive-elements-reference.html"><div class="menuItem_71eca mt-0.5 py-2 px-3 font-medium flex" style="font-size: 13px; margin-left: 18px; border-radius: 0 var(--rp-radius) var(--rp-radius) 0;"><span>Interactive Elements</span></div></a></div><div class="rspress-sidebar-item"><a class="link_03735 menuLink_71eca cursor-pointer" target="" href="/pumble/build/api-client.html"><div class="menuItem_71eca mt-0.5 py-2 px-3 font-medium flex" style="font-size: 13px; margin-left: 18px; border-radius: 0 var(--rp-radius) var(--rp-radius) 0;"><span>Api Client</span></div></a></div><div class="rspress-sidebar-item"><a class="link_03735 menuLink_71eca cursor-pointer" target="" href="/pumble/build/blocks.html"><div class="menuItem_71eca mt-0.5 py-2 px-3 font-medium flex" style="font-size: 13px; margin-left: 18px; border-radius: 0 var(--rp-radius) var(--rp-radius) 0;"><span>Blocks</span></div></a></div></div></div></section><section class="rspress-sidebar-section mt-0.5 block" data-context="sidebar-publish-pumble" style="margin-left: 0px;"><div class="rspress-sidebar-collapse flex justify-between items-center menuItem_71eca" data-context="sidebar-publish-pumble" style="border-radius: 0 var(--rp-radius) var(--rp-radius) 0;"><h2 class="py-2 px-3 text-sm font-medium flex" style="font-size: 14px; padding-left: 24px; font-weight: bold;"><span class="flex-center" style="font-size: 14px;">PUBLISH</span></h2></div><div class="transition-all duration-300 ease-in-out" style="overflow: hidden;"><div class="rspress-sidebar-group transition-opacity duration-500 ease-in-out" style="opacity: 1; margin-left: 12px;"><div class="rspress-sidebar-item"><a class="link_03735 menuLink_71eca cursor-pointer" target="" href="/pumble/publish/publishing-and-guidelines.html"><div class="menuItem_71eca mt-0.5 py-2 px-3 font-medium flex" style="font-size: 13px; margin-left: 18px; border-radius: 0 var(--rp-radius) var(--rp-radius) 0;"><span>Publishing and Guidelines</span></div></a></div><div class="rspress-sidebar-item"><a class="link_03735 menuLink_71eca cursor-pointer" target="" href="/pumble/publish/private-addon-deployment.html"><div class="menuItemActive_71eca mt-0.5 py-2 px-3 font-medium flex" style="font-size: 13px; margin-left: 18px; border-radius: 0 var(--rp-radius) var(--rp-radius) 0;"><span>Private addon deployment</span></div></a></div></div></div></section></nav></div></aside><div class="content_edeb4 rspress-doc-container flex flex-shrink-0 mx-auto"><div class="w-full flex-1"><div><div class="rspress-doc"><h1 id="private-add-ons-documentation" class="rspress-doc-title text-3xl mb-10 leading-10 tracking-tight title_3b154">Private Add-ons Documentation<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#private-add-ons-documentation">#</a></h1>
<h2 id="introduction-to-private-add-ons" class="mt-12 mb-6 pt-8 text-2xl tracking-tight border-t-[1px] border-divider-light title_3b154">Introduction to Private Add-ons<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#introduction-to-private-add-ons">#</a></h2>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Private add-ons allow developers to create solutions accessible only to specific workspaces, ideal for internal testing and use. This feature encourages users with custom integrations to transition to managed add-ons, enhancing security.</p>
<h2 id="creating-a-private-add-on" class="mt-12 mb-6 pt-8 text-2xl tracking-tight border-t-[1px] border-divider-light title_3b154">Creating a Private Add-on<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#creating-a-private-add-on">#</a></h2>
<h3 id="steps-to-create" class="mt-10 mb-2 leading-7 text-xl title_3b154">Steps to Create:<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#steps-to-create">#</a></h3>
<ol class="list-decimal pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><strong class="font-semibold">Set Visibility</strong>: Set Visibility: During creation, select "Private" visibility.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><strong class="font-semibold">Whitelist Workspaces</strong>:  Define up to three workspaces by their IDs for access.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><strong class="font-semibold">Manifest key</strong>: If you already have the add-on in production, the manifest key needs to be different since the private add-on is technically a new add-on.</li>
</ol>
<blockquote class="border-l-2 border-solid border-divider pl-4 my-6 transition-colors duration-500 blockquote_3b154">
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><strong class="font-semibold">Note</strong>: You can find your workspace ID by going to the workspace settings.</p>
</blockquote>
<h2 id="managing-a-private-add-on" class="mt-12 mb-6 pt-8 text-2xl tracking-tight border-t-[1px] border-divider-light title_3b154">Managing a Private Add-on<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#managing-a-private-add-on">#</a></h2>
<h3 id="updating-versions" class="mt-10 mb-2 leading-7 text-xl title_3b154">Updating Versions<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#updating-versions">#</a></h3>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Maintain whitelists across versions unless changes are needed.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Upon removing a workspace from whitelists, the add-on is automatically uninstalled.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">When a new workspace is added, an email is sent notifying the user about the add-on.</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="publishing-a-private-add-on" class="mt-12 mb-6 pt-8 text-2xl tracking-tight border-t-[1px] border-divider-light title_3b154">Publishing a Private Add-on<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#publishing-a-private-add-on">#</a></h2>
<h3 id="key-differences" class="mt-10 mb-2 leading-7 text-xl title_3b154">Key Differences:<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#key-differences">#</a></h3>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><strong class="font-semibold">No Payment Setup</strong>: Skip payment configuration.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><strong class="font-semibold">No Vendor Profile</strong>: Not required for private distribution.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><strong class="font-semibold">No Review Process</strong>: Immediate publication post-submission.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><strong class="font-semibold">Can delete a Private Add-on without waiting.</strong></li>
</ul>
<h3 id="deleting-a-private-add-on" class="mt-10 mb-2 leading-7 text-xl title_3b154">Deleting a Private Add-on:<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#deleting-a-private-add-on">#</a></h3>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Deletion is immediate. All installations are removed upon deletion.</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="installing-a-private-add-on" class="mt-12 mb-6 pt-8 text-2xl tracking-tight border-t-[1px] border-divider-light title_3b154">Installing a Private Add-on<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#installing-a-private-add-on">#</a></h2>
<h3 id="admin-instructions" class="mt-10 mb-2 leading-7 text-xl title_3b154">Admin Instructions:<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#admin-instructions">#</a></h3>
<ol class="list-decimal pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><strong class="font-semibold">Receive URL</strong>: Obtain installation link via email notification.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><strong class="font-semibold">Install</strong>: Use provided URL to install the add-on.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><strong class="font-semibold">Visibility</strong>: See "Private" status in Clockify, distinguishing from public versions.</li>
</ol></div><div class="rspress-doc-footer"><footer class="mt-8"><div class="xs:flex pb-5 px-2 justify-end items-center"></div><div class="flex flex-col"></div><div class="flex flex-col sm:flex-row class="desc_9b9a7">Previous Page</span><span class="title_9b9a7">Publishing and Guidelines</span></a></div><div class="next_e7091 flex flex-col"></div></div></footer></div></div></div><button xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" aria-hidden="true" viewBox="0 0 24 24" class="dark:hidden" width="18" height="18" fill="currentColor"><path d="M12 18c-3.3 0-6-2.7-6-6s2.7-6 6-6 6 2.7 6 6-2.7 6-6 6zm0-10c-2.2 0-4 1.8-4 4s1.8 4 4 4 4-1.8 4-4-1.8-4-4-4zM12 4c-.6 0-1-.4-1-1V1c0-.6.4-1 1-1s1 .4 1 1v2c0 .6-.4 1-1 1zM12 24c-.6 0-1-.4-1-1v-2c0-.6.4-1 1-1s1 .4 1 1v2c0 .6-.4 1-1 1zM5.6 6.6c-.3 0-.5-.1-.7-.3L3.5 4.9c-.4-.4-.4-1 0-1.4s1-.4 1.4 0l1.4 1.4c.4.4.4 1 0 1.4-.1.2-.4.3-.7.3zM19.8 20.8c-.3 0-.5-.1-.7-.3l-1.4-1.4c-.4-.4-.4-1 0-1.4s1-.4 1.4 0l1.4 1.4c.4.4.4 1 0 1.4-.2.2-.5.3-.7.3zM3 13H1c-.6 0-1-.4-1-1s.4-1 1-1h2c.6 0 1 .4 1 1s-.4 1-1 1zM23 13h-2c-.6 0-1-.4-1-1s.4-1 1-1h2c.6 0 1 .4 1 1s-.4 1-1 1zM4.2 20.8c-.3 0-.5-.1-.7-.3-.4-.4-.4-1 0-1.4l1.4-1.4c.4-.4 1-.4 1.4 0s.4 1 0 1.4l-1.4 1.4c-.2.2-.4.3-.7.3zM18.4 6.6c-.3 0-.5-.1-.7-.3-.4-.4-.4-1 0-1.4l1.4-1.4c.4-.4 1-.4 1.4 0s.4 1 0 1.4l-1.4 1.4c-.2.2-.5.3-.7.3z"></path></svg><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" aria-hidden="true" viewBox="0 0 24 24" class="hidden dark:block" width="18" height="18" fill="currentColor"><path d="M12.1 22h-.9c-5.5-.5-9.5-5.4-9-10.9.4-4.8 4.2-8.6 9-9 .4 0 .8.2 1 .5.2.3.2.8-.1 1.1-2 2.7-1.4 6.4 1.3 8.4 2.1 1.6 5 1.6 7.1 0 .3-.2.7-.3 1.1-.1.3.2.5.6.5 1-.2 2.7-1.5 5.1-3.6 6.8-1.9 1.4-4.1 2.2-6.4 2.2zM9.3 4.4c-2.9 1-5 3.6-5.2 6.8-.4 4.4 2.8 8.3 7.2 8.7 2.1.2 4.2-.4 5.8-1.8 1.1-.9 1.9-2.1 12px;"><span class="rspress-toc-link-text block">How to delete add-on?</span></a></li><li><a href="#how-to-delete-add-on-version-request" class="rspress-toc-link sm:text-normal text-sm" text-sm" style="margin-left: 0px;"><span class="rspress-toc-link-text block">Data privacy guidelines</span></a></li><li><a href="#clearly-explain-your-data-privacy-practices" class="rspress-toc-link sm:text-normal text-sm" style="margin-left: 12px;"><span class="rspress-toc-link-text block">Clearly explain your data privacy practices</span></a></li><li><a href="#minimize-the-data-you-collect" href="#get-consent-for-certain-data-use" class="rspress-toc-link sm:text-normal text-sm" style="margin-left: 12px;"><span class="rspress-toc-link-text block">Get consent for certain data use</span></a></li><li><a href="#provide-access-modification-and-erasure-of-personal-data" class="rspress-toc-link sm:text-normal text-sm" style="margin-left: 12px;"><span class="rspress-toc-link-text block">Provide access, modification and erasure of personal data</span></a></li><li><a href="#offer-additional-data-processing-terms" class="rspress-toc-link sm:text-normal text-sm" class="rspress-sidebar-collapse flex justify-between items-center menuItem_71eca" data-context="sidebar-publish-clockify" style="border-radius: 0 var(--rp-radius) var(--rp-radius) 0;"><h2 class="py-2 class="link_03735 menuLink_71eca cursor-pointer" target="" href="/clockify/publish/publishing-and-guidelines.html"><div class="menuItemActive_71eca mt-0.5 py-2 px-3 font-medium flex" style="font-size: border-radius: 0 var(--rp-radius) var(--rp-radius) 0;"><span>Private addon deployment</span></div></a></div></div></div></section></nav></div></aside><div class="content_edeb4 rspress-doc-container flex flex-shrink-0 mx-auto"><div class="w-full flex-1"><div><div class="rspress-doc"><h1 id="publishing" class="rspress-doc-title text-3xl mb-10 leading-10 tracking-tight title_3b154">Publishing<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#publishing">#</a></h1>
<h2 id="guidelines--best-practices" class="mt-12 mb-6 pt-8 text-2xl tracking-tight border-t-[1px] border-divider-light title_3b154">Guidelines &amp; best practices<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#guidelines--best-practices">#</a></h2>
<h3 id="whats-the-criteria-add-ons-need-to-meet-in-order-to-be-published" class="mt-10 mb-2 leading-7 text-xl title_3b154">What’s the criteria add-ons need to meet in order to be published?<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#whats-the-criteria-add-ons-need-to-meet-in-order-to-be-published">#</a></h3>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">We want to make sure that every individual using any CAKE.com Marketplace add-on gets a product that is useful, has high performance and uses their data responsibly.
That’s why we’ve compiled a set of instructions and guidelines that can help you build the add-on that meets these standards. Prior to building, please, take a couple of minutes and read through these to make sure that the add-on you want to build complies with the requirements listed below.</p>
<h3 id="what-are-general-guidelines-for-add-on-content" class="mt-10 mb-2 leading-7 text-xl title_3b154">What are general guidelines for add-on content?<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#what-are-general-guidelines-for-add-on-content">#</a></h3>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Become familiar with the system.</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Clockify is a complex system consisting of many components with all sorts of dependencies between them: Timesheet, Timetracker, Calendar, Report, Project, etc. They all work together and complement each other perfectly. That’s why, it’s important you’re familiar with all the entities and patterns that Clockify comprises, so that you can use them in a way that Clockify’s customers are familiar with.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">To better understand elements used to build Clockify, check out Clockify’s <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://clockify.me/help/getting-started/clockify_basics/clockify-glossary" class="link_03735  link_3b154 inline-link_3b154">Glossary of terms</a>.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Strive to enhance customer experience.</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">If you’re already our customer, you can start building an app that will benefit you and your team, solve your problems and later share it with everyone else.
If you’ve never used our product, we recommend you create <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://app.clockify.me/en/login" class="link_03735  link_3b154 inline-link_3b154">a free account</a>. Try to build something new and unique.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Be clear about the purpose.</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Sharing data with a third party can be scary for some users. Therefore, you should be clear on how what you built adds value to their customer experience and state clearly what their data will (and won’t) be used for.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Don’t mislead your users.</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Make sure you clearly stated add-on’s purpose and necessary details when creating your first version. You should also provide clear descriptions, screenshots and videos in order to describe your add-on accurately.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Explore our branding guidelines.</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Since an add-on you’re building will be part of an existing product, we suggest you take a look at our <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://www.figma.com/@cake_dot_com" class="link_03735  link_3b154 inline-link_3b154">product branding guidelines</a> and check if the assets you built follow these guidelines before you submit an add-on for a review.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Make an easy setup.</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">More people are likely to use an add-on that’s easy to set up. This is one of the crucial characteristics that attracts new users.
For instance, if using your product requires an account, it should be created by getting the credentials from Clockify. If you need to ask customers to sign up manually, you should pre-fill some user information, e.g. user email.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Inform user of a third-party account.</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">If, in order to use add-on, user needs to create a separate third-party account (i.e. log in to another service), this must be stated clearly to the user in the description and the overview of the add-on.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Check grammar and spelling.</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Add-on should not contain any typos, or grammatical errors. Therefore, check grammar and spelling prior to submitting it for a review.</p>
<h3 id="is-there-any-type-of-content-that-is-prohibited" class="mt-10 mb-2 leading-7 text-xl title_3b154">Is there any type of content that is prohibited?<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#is-there-any-type-of-content-that-is-prohibited">#</a></h3>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">To ensure that CAKE.com Marketplace is a safe platform, we’ve created standards that define and prohibit content that is harmful, inappropriate or offensive to others.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Hate speech.</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Add-ons that promote violence, or incite hatred against individuals, or a group of individuals based on race, ethnicity, religion, age, disability, nationality, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, or any other characteristic associated with discrimination will not be published.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Violence.</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">We don’t allow add-ons that facilitate or promote violence or endangerment of an individual’s safety.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Bullying and harassment.</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Add-ons that contain or encourage threats, harassment and bullying will not be published.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Harmful and malicious products.</strong></em></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Add-ons that promote or support any type of harmful and malicious products won’t be published.</p>
<h3 id="final-note" class="mt-10 mb-2 leading-7 text-xl title_3b154">Final note<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#final-note">#</a></h3>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Keep in mind that assets that contain any type of prohibited content will not be published. Also, any prohibited, or harmful content that is added after reviewing and publishing, and reported by users, will be removed from the marketplace immediately.
Please note that these guidelines should be used in addition to our <a class="link_03735  link_3b154 inline-link_3b154 cursor-pointer" target="" href="/terms.html">Terms of Use</a>, <a class="link_03735  link_3b154 inline-link_3b154 cursor-pointer" target="" href="/privacy.html">Privacy Policy</a>, <a href="#security-requirements" class="link_3b154 ">Security Requirements</a> and <a class="link_03735  link_3b154 inline-link_3b154 cursor-pointer" target="" href="/cake-com-marketplace-listing-agreement.html">Listing Agreement</a>. Be sure to read all of these documents.
Also, keep in mind that these guidelines evolve along with our business. Feel free to get in touch if you have any feedback, or suggestions.</p>
<h2 id="create-add-on" class="mt-12 mb-6 pt-8 text-2xl tracking-tight border-t-[1px] border-divider-light title_3b154">Create add-on<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#create-add-on">#</a></h2>
<h3 id="how-to-create-add-on" class="mt-10 mb-2 leading-7 text-xl title_3b154">How to create add-on?<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#how-to-create-add-on">#</a></h3>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">You’ll have complete independence and autonomy over building your add-on. This means that you’ll build it locally, but before submitting your code for a review, you should test it in the testing environment provided to you. Also, check out our <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://docs.developer.clockify.me/" class="link_03735  link_3b154 inline-link_3b154">REST API documentation</a> and Development Toolkit section to get a better insight on how to build and maintain add-ons. Add-on then needs to be approved by our developers in the reviewing process and then it can be published.<br>
To make sure the whole process goes smoothly and your request is approved shortly, we will provide you with the necessary requirements and standards all CAKE.com add-ons should meet in order to be published.</p>
<blockquote class="border-l-2 border-solid border-divider pl-4 my-6 transition-colors duration-500 blockquote_3b154">
<p class="my-4 leading-7">When creating an add-on you’re actually creating the first version of your add-on. All subsequent iterations will be defined as versions in the Marketplace (e.g. v 1.0.1).</p>
</blockquote>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">To create add-on:</p>
<ol class="list-decimal pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Log in or sign up for your <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://developer.marketplace.cake.com/" class="link_03735  link_3b154 inline-link_3b154">developer account</a></li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Go to <em><strong class="font-semibold">Add-ons</strong></em> page</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Click <em><strong class="font-semibold">CREATE ADD-ON</strong></em></li>
</ol>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Now, complete a two-step process and enter the required data.</p>
<ol class="list-decimal pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Basic information</li>
</ol>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><img src="/static/image/create-add-on.5848b57c.png" alt="Create Add-on" class="medium-zoom-image"></p>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Add-on icon</strong></em>: Upload image</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Add-on name</strong></em>: Choose a descriptive name that users can easily understand</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Add-on manifest</strong></em>: Enter URL</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Product</strong></em>: Refers to the application for which you are creating add-on</li>
</ul>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">At the moment, you can only choose Clockify. You’ll be able to create add-ons for Pumble and Plaky soon.</p>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Visibility</strong></em>: Public – Add-on is visible to everyone and allows users within the CAKE.com community to share it.</li>
</ul>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">At the moment, add-ons can only be public. Private add-ons are coming soon.</p>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Pricing model</strong></em>: Define pricing model for your add-on.</li>
</ul>
<div class="language-bash"><div class="rspress-code-content rspress-scrollbar"><code>Free
Paid
</code></div></div>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Click <em><strong class="font-semibold">NEXT</strong></em> to proceed to the second step of the form.</p>
<blockquote class="border-l-2 border-solid border-divider pl-4 my-6 transition-colors duration-500 blockquote_3b154">
<p class="my-4 leading-7">You can always save the form as draft and edit it later.</p>
</blockquote>
<ol start="2" class="list-decimal pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Listing</li>
</ol>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Information you add in the listing will be available in the Marketplace. Use it to help drive users to your add-on.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><img src="/static/image/listing-add-on.630186ee.png" alt="Listing Add-on" class="medium-zoom-image"></p>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Choose category</strong></em>: Define a niche or business sector you’d like to improve by building this add-on. In the Marketplace, published add-on will be placed in the category you selected here.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Short description</strong></em>: Give a short overview of the purpose of your add-on and solution it provides</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Long description</strong></em>: Explain what your add-on is providing in greater detail and the value it brings to users</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Privacy policy</strong></em>: Define privacy policy and clearly disclose which information you’re collecting in this manner</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Terms of use</strong></em> (optional): Along with privacy policy, you can also add terms of use users need to agree to, in order to proceed with installation</li>
</ul>
<blockquote class="border-l-2 border-solid border-divider pl-4 my-6 transition-colors duration-500 blockquote_3b154">
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Please keep in mind that, if there are some contradictory statements in terms of use you provided here, to those written by our legal team, CAKE.com’s legal policy should be followed.</p>
</blockquote>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Website</strong></em> (optional): Add a link to the website that contains more information about add-on. Creating a website that promotes your add-on can help you attract more users.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Add-on gallery</strong></em> (optional): Upload a set of images, or screenshots that reflect the purpose and promote your add-on in the best way. You can upload up to 5 images.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2"><em><strong class="font-semibold">Demo video</strong></em> (optional): Add demo to spread the word, boost traffic, or use it as an instructional video. Video needs to be publicly accessible on YouTube.</li>
</ul>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">We encourage you to provide some additional instructions, including information that would be relevant to the person doing an add-on review like some additional notes or any other kind of specific guidelines.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Finally, by checking the Marketplace Listing Terms box you agree that you’ll meet and oblige the <a class="link_03735  link_3b154 inline-link_3b154 cursor-pointer" target="" href="/cake-com-marketplace-listing-agreement.html">listing terms</a> stated there as long as your add-on is part of the CAKE.com Marketplace.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Information provided in this step will be published and available along with the add-on on the <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://marketplace.cake.com/" class="link_03735  link_3b154 inline-link_3b154">Marketplace website</a>.</p>
<blockquote class="border-l-2 border-solid border-divider pl-4 my-6 transition-colors duration-500 blockquote_3b154">
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Information provided in the two-step forms above, must be written in English.</p>
</blockquote>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">After you’ve completed the two steps, click the <em><strong class="font-semibold">SUBMIT FOR REVIEW</strong></em> button and your add-on will be submitted to the CAKE.com Marketplace team for a review.</p>
<blockquote class="border-l-2 border-solid border-divider pl-4 my-6 transition-colors duration-500 blockquote_3b154">
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Once you’ve submitted your add-on for a review, our team will start the reviewing process soon as possible.</p>
</blockquote>
<h3 id="how-does-reviewing-work" class="mt-10 mb-2 leading-7 text-xl title_3b154">How does reviewing work?<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#how-does-reviewing-work">#</a></h3>
<blockquote class="border-l-2 border-solid border-divider pl-4 my-6 transition-colors duration-500 blockquote_3b154">
<p class="my-4 leading-7">In order to successfully submit your add-on version for a review, all the fields need to be filled out correctly and there should be no pending requests.</p>
</blockquote>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Once you click the <em><strong class="font-semibold">SUBMIT FOR REVIEW</strong></em> button, a new add-on version request will be created. Request will get a pending status and will be sent to our team for a review. You will get an email that confirms you have successfully submitted a request for new version.</p>
<blockquote class="border-l-2 border-solid border-divider pl-4 my-6 transition-colors duration-500 blockquote_3b154">
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Reviewing process will take approximately two weeks.</p>
</blockquote>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">When it’s done, you will receive an email informing you that your request is approved, or denied. The request will also be appropriately marked as approved or denied in your profile.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">If denied, we’ll send you the feedback notes from our team that could help you understand why the request was denied. You’ll also be able to see the request, edit it based on the feedback you received and submit it for a review again.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">If approved, you can continue and publish the version directly from the email you received, by clicking <em><strong class="font-semibold">PUBLISH</strong></em>. You’ll receive another confirmation email that will inform you that your add-on is published and available in the marketplace. Click <em><strong class="font-semibold">View [addonname]</strong></em> to see it in the marketplace.</p>
<h2 id="create-version--publish" class="mt-12 mb-6 pt-8 text-2xl tracking-tight border-t-[1px] border-divider-light title_3b154">Create version &amp; publish<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#create-version--publish">#</a></h2>
<h3 id="how-to-create-new-version" class="mt-10 mb-2 leading-7 text-xl title_3b154">How to create new version?<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#how-to-create-new-version">#</a></h3>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Every created add-on must have a version. Versioning add-ons helps you create and improve add-on’s functionality easily and gradually without causing inconvenience to your users.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">In order to create a new version, at least one version of an add-on needs to be published. Learn more about how to create add-on’s first version on Create Add-on section above.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">First version will be automatically created as version 1.0.0. For each new request, you need to manually add the version number. Version number should reflect complexity of the functionalities with major version being marked as e.g. 1.1.0 and minor version as e.g. 1.0.1. Also, keep in mind that version numbers should be marked in a logical progression, e.g. 2.0.0 version cannot be followed by version 1.5.0.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Creating new version is a three-step process similar to the one used to create an add-on.
However, when creating new version, add-on name and icon in the Basic information page are generated from the published version, but can be edited. Steps two and three are the same.</p>
<h3 id="which-status-can-version-request-have" class="mt-10 mb-2 leading-7 text-xl title_3b154">Which status can version request have?<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#which-status-can-version-request-have">#</a></h3>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Based on its lifecycle stage, status of add-on’s version request can be:</p>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Draft</li>
</ul>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Version request is in draft if you haven’t completed all the steps when creating an add-on, but you saved information you entered by clicking the Save as draft button.</p>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Pending</li>
</ul>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">When you submit the version for a review, its status is updated to Pending. After review, the version can be approved or declined with status changing accordingly.</p>
<blockquote class="border-l-2 border-solid border-divider pl-4 my-6 transition-colors duration-500 blockquote_3b154">
<p class="my-4 leading-7">There can be only one pending request per add-on.</p>
</blockquote>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Declined</li>
</ul>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">After your version is reviewed, it can be approved or declined. If your version is declined, along with that information, you will also get an explanation on why. You can edit the declined version based on this feedback and submit it for a review again.</p>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Approved</li>
</ul>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">An approved version is approved by our team. It goes further into the publishing cycle and is ready to be published.</p>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Published</li>
</ul>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">This is the final step in the publishing cycle. Once the version is approved, it can be published and when published it becomes available in the marketplace for everyone to use.
After you published one add-on version, you can proceed by creating a new one.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Once your add-on (first, or any subsequent version) has been published on the CAKE.com Marketplace, you’ll receive a confirmation email saying that your add-on version has been successfully published.</p>
<blockquote class="border-l-2 border-solid border-divider pl-4 my-6 transition-colors duration-500 blockquote_3b154">
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Add-on can have only one published version.</p>
</blockquote>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">If an add-on is already in the marketplace, once its new version request is published, the existing published version immediately becomes outdated.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><img src="/static/image/add-on-statuses.3fad1f11.png" alt="Add-on Statuses" class="medium-zoom-image"></p>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Outdated</li>
</ul>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">If a newer version is published, the existing one becomes automatically deprecated and outdated.</p>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Unlisted</li>
</ul>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">This status is added to the published version that has been removed from the marketplace and can’t be used or installed by new users. However, those who use the unlisted version can still see and use it.</p>
<h2 id="delete-add-on" class="mt-12 mb-6 pt-8 text-2xl tracking-tight border-t-[1px] border-divider-light title_3b154">Delete add-on<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#delete-add-on">#</a></h2>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">You can delete an entire add-on with all of its versions regardless of their status, or just an add-on’s version request. You can do both of these actions from the Add-ons page, in your profile. However, deleting an entire add-on requires sending a request to our support team.</p>
<h3 id="how-to-delete-add-on" class="mt-10 mb-2 leading-7 text-xl title_3b154">How to delete add-on?<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#how-to-delete-add-on">#</a></h3>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">If you’d like to delete your add-on, you can do that from the <em><strong class="font-semibold">Add-ons</strong></em> page.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">To delete an add-on:</p>
<ol class="list-decimal pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Click <em><strong class="font-semibold">Delete add-on</strong></em> in the bottom right corner</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Delete add-on modal appears</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Click <em><strong class="font-semibold">SEND REQUEST</strong></em></li>
</ol>
<p class="my-4 leading-7"><img src="/static/image/delete-add-on.72e66493.png" alt="Add-on Delete" class="medium-zoom-image"></p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">After you’ve sent the request to delete an add-on, our support team will contact you shortly, and ask for confirmation. Soon after your confirmation, the process of deletion will start. Add-on users will receive an email that informs them of deletion and you will receive an email that notifies you that the process has begun.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Once the process has started, add-on is unlisted, removed from the marketplace and unavailable for new users. The existing users will be able to use the add-on until it is deleted. To ensure that they are informed, after the deletion process is set in motion, information of the deletion and add-on’s retirement date will be prominently displayed at the top of the page throughout the application.</p>
<blockquote class="border-l-2 border-solid border-divider pl-4 my-6 transition-colors duration-500 blockquote_3b154">
<p class="my-4 leading-7">The process of deletion lasts 31 days. An add-on will be deleted at the end of the last day at midnight. This process cannot be canceled or reversed.</p>
</blockquote>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">After it is deleted:</p>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Add-on will be deleted from the marketplace</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Your profile and all users will lose access to it</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Subscription will be canceled for paid add-ons</li>
</ul>
<h3 id="how-to-delete-add-on-version-request" class="mt-10 mb-2 leading-7 text-xl title_3b154">How to delete add-on version request?<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#how-to-delete-add-on-version-request">#</a></h3>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">If you don’t want to continue with the process of creating a new add-on version, you can delete it in the request preview table, in the <em><strong class="font-semibold">Add-ons</strong></em> page.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">When deleting an add-on version, depending on the status of the version, different actions are available.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">If version is in:</p>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Draft</li>
</ul>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">If this is the only version request for this add-on, by deleting it, you will delete an entire add-on and if not, you will delete only draft version of this add-on.</p>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Pending</li>
</ul>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">If this is the only version request for this add-on, by deleting it, you will delete an entire add-on and if not, you will delete only draft version of this add-on.</p>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Approved</li>
</ul>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">If this is the only version request for this add-on, by deleting it, you will delete an entire add-on and if not, you will delete only draft version of this add-on.</p>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Declined</li>
</ul>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">If this is the only version request for this add-on, by deleting it, you will delete an entire add-on and if not, you will delete only draft version of this add-on.</p>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Outdated</li>
</ul>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">If this is the only version request for this add-on, by deleting it, you will delete an entire add-on and if not, you will delete only draft version of this add-on.</p>
<blockquote class="border-l-2 border-solid border-divider pl-4 my-6 transition-colors duration-500 blockquote_3b154">
<p class="my-4 leading-7">You cannot delete the Unlisted and Published add-on versions since that action would affect potential users of those add-ons.</p>
</blockquote>
<h2 id="data-privacy-guidelines" class="mt-12 mb-6 pt-8 text-2xl tracking-tight border-t-[1px] border-divider-light title_3b154">Data privacy guidelines<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#data-privacy-guidelines">#</a></h2>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">As you’ll have access to customer information which includes personal data, it’s important how you store and handle the data. Personal data is sensitive and in many cases regulated by applicable laws. Listed below are best practices you should follow, in addition to the <a class="link_03735  link_3b154 inline-link_3b154 cursor-pointer" target="" href="/terms.html">Terms of Use</a>, when developing the add-on on the CAKE.com marketplace.</p>
<h3 id="clearly-explain-your-data-privacy-practices" class="mt-10 mb-2 leading-7 text-xl title_3b154">Clearly explain your data privacy practices<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#clearly-explain-your-data-privacy-practices">#</a></h3>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">When submitting your add-on for review you are required to provide a Privacy policy which should explain to the users how you plan on using their data. The privacy policy should clearly explain to the user what data the add-on will collect, how that data will be used, who will have access to the data and explain the user’s choice.</p>
<h3 id="minimize-the-data-you-collect" class="mt-10 mb-2 leading-7 text-xl title_3b154">Minimize the data you collect<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#minimize-the-data-you-collect">#</a></h3>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Collect data only where you need it. Do not collect the data because you think it may be useful later. Where personal data is involved, consider de-identifying it. Also consider deleting user data when they request it or when they uninstall your add-on. Have in mind that you don’t need to store data indefinitely, put some data retention schemes in place.</p>
<h3 id="get-consent-for-certain-data-use" class="mt-10 mb-2 leading-7 text-xl title_3b154">Get consent for certain data use<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#get-consent-for-certain-data-use">#</a></h3>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">When submitting an add-on for review you’ll have to check which data you collect in the permissions tab. You should only collect the data you checked in that tab. In this way users consent to the usage of their data when installing an add-on, but only for the purpose of an add-on. Using data for marketing, sharing data with third-parties and other data use cases not strictly required to support the operation of your add-on may require a separate consent from the user before collecting or using the data. As a general rule of thumb, you should always get consent if the user would not expect their data to be used or shared in a particular way given the purpose of your add-on.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Consent may not be embedded in a privacy policy. Instead, it must be collected from the user directly. You are responsible for collecting and maintaining all such consents, either through the add-on itself or through direct communication with the add-on user.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Note, regardless of whether you obtain consent, some data use cases may be prohibited by the <a class="link_03735  link_3b154 inline-link_3b154 cursor-pointer" target="" href="/terms.html">Terms of Use</a>. You are responsible for reviewing and complying with those terms.</p>
<h3 id="provide-access-modification-and-erasure-of-personal-data" class="mt-10 mb-2 leading-7 text-xl title_3b154">Provide access, modification and erasure of personal data<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#provide-access-modification-and-erasure-of-personal-data">#</a></h3>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">Applicable laws and data management best practices require that you make it easy for users to get a copy of, correct and delete their personal data. This means, if you are storing personal data, you need to know where that personal data is at all times and be able to update it or remove it upon request.</p>
<h3 id="offer-additional-data-processing-terms" class="mt-10 mb-2 leading-7 text-xl title_3b154">Offer additional data processing terms<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#offer-additional-data-processing-terms">#</a></h3>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">If you are accessing, storing or otherwise processing personal data of EEA residents, users may request that you sign and comply with additional data protection terms, consistent with Article 28 of the General Data Protection Regulation (“GDPR”). You are responsible for understanding and complying with the terms required under Article 28 of the GDPR as it relates to the user data you access, store or otherwise process in connection with the user’s consent to install and share data with your add-on.</p>
<h3 id="invest-in-data-security" class="mt-10 mb-2 leading-7 text-xl title_3b154">Invest in data security<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#invest-in-data-security">#</a></h3>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">You must take reasonable steps to protect user data shared with you and collected by your add-on, including user device information. We recommend you to follow our Security guidelines for a more comprehensive list for securing your add-on.</p>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">In the event your add-on or suppliers experience a data security breach, you are responsible for communicating with users and regulators, as required by applicable law. It’s also important to let us know of the incident by emailing to <a href="mailto:support@cake.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" class="link_03735  link_3b154 inline-link_3b154">support@cake.com</a>.</p>
<h2 id="security-requirements" class="mt-12 mb-6 pt-8 text-2xl tracking-tight border-t-[1px] border-divider-light title_3b154">Security requirements<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#security-requirements">#</a></h2>
<h3 id="authentication--authorization" class="mt-10 mb-2 leading-7 text-xl title_3b154">Authentication &amp; authorization<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#authentication--authorization">#</a></h3>
<p class="my-4 leading-7">An add-on must authenticate and authorize every request on all endpoints exposed. Anonymous access to application endpoints and resources can be allowed in scenarios where it is needed.</p>
<h3 id="data-protection" class="mt-10 mb-2 leading-7 text-xl title_3b154">Data protection<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#data-protection">#</a></h3>
<ol class="list-decimal pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Any CAKE.com End User Data stored by an application outside of the CAKE.com product or users’ browser must ensure full disk encryption at-rest. If accessed by an application or a service, it should be authenticated and authorized appropriately.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">An application must use TLS version 1.2 (or higher) to encrypt all of its traffic, and enable HSTS with a minimum age of one year.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">An application must follow the “Principle of Least Privilege”, when requesting app scopes. This means that an application should only request scopes required to perform its intended functionality, and nothing more.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">An application must securely store and manage secrets, which include OAuth tokens,  sharedSecret, API keys, and encryption keys. They cannot be stored in places that are easily accessible. Examples of places include:</li>
</ol>
<ul class="list-disc pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Source code and code repository tools, such as Bitbucket and Github</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">URL strings</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Referer headers</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Application logs</li>
</ul>
<h3 id="application-security" class="mt-10 mb-2 leading-7 text-xl title_3b154">Application security<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#application-security">#</a></h3>
<ol class="list-decimal pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">An application must maintain and securely configure domains where the application is hosted.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">When applicable, an application must enable security headers and cookie security attributes.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">An application must validate and sanitize all untrusted data and treat all user input as unsafe to mitigate injection-related vulnerabilities. Untrusted data is any input that can be manipulated to contain a web attack payload.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">An application must not use versions of third-party libraries and dependencies with known critical or high vulnerabilities. When vulnerabilities in these libraries and dependencies are discovered, application developers must remediate them as quickly as possible.</li>
</ol>
<h3 id="privacy" class="mt-10 mb-2 leading-7 text-xl title_3b154">Privacy<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#privacy">#</a></h3>
<ol class="list-decimal pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">An application must not collect or store credentials belonging to CAKE.com user accounts such as user passwords or user API tokens.</li>
</ol>
<h3 id="vulnerability-management" class="mt-10 mb-2 leading-7 text-xl title_3b154">Vulnerability management<a class="link_3b154 header-anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#vulnerability-management">#</a></h3>
<ol class="list-decimal pl-5 my-4 leading-7">
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">You must notify CAKE.com of all security incidents via <a href="mailto:support@cake.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" class="link_03735  link_3b154 inline-link_3b154">support@cake.com</a>.</li>
<li class="[&amp;:not(:first-child)]:mt-2">Your account email will be taken as a security contact where you’ll be notified about vulnerabilities in the app.</li>
</ol></div><div class="rspress-doc-footer"><footer class="mt-8"><div class="xs:flex pb-5 px-2 justify-end items-center"></div><div class="flex flex-col"></div><div class="flex flex-col sm:flex-row ## API Documentation

Our APIs are organized around REST principles. They have resource-oriented URLs, and use application/JSON-encoded requests and responses.

> Source: https://dev-docs.marketplace.cake.com/cake-com-marketplace-listing-agreement.html

⌘K
